body: My opinion is that libs ideally support the max number of Java versions. [Multi-Release jar](https://openjdk.org/jeps/238) support is there to help us optimise support for different Java versions.
Which JDK version do you have in mind, with multi-release jar strategy @pjfanning?

issue.title: Jackson V3 - Use JDK 11/17 as the minimum required

labels.name: to-evaluate
labels.description: Issue that has been received but not yet evaluated

repository.name: jackson-databind
repository.description: General data-binding package for Jackson (2.x): works on streaming API (core) implementation(s)

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
The movement of JDK's is accelerating, with a 460% increase in adoption of JDK 17 for the period 2022/2023.
JDK 8 EOL is getting to a decade out of date

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Is it possible to mark Jackson v3 for JDK 11, or JDK 17 as a base? As an example, Guice and other providers are setting the minimum JDK's, and compatibility is being affected having a build of JDK 8

**Usage example**
For JDK 11, no updates are necessary, as the test project (jackson-jdk11-test) compiles cleanly, 
For JDK 17, there may be updates required to conform to the strict encapsulation requirements of the JDK

**Additional context**
Should be a simple switch to the source/target/ and release compiler flags in the POM

Relates to
https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-modules-base/pull/209

body:
I would prefer not having to use MR for anything, personally. But if we must for something I guess we can try figuring it out.

But even if we do, we need to set up minimum baseline and I think Java 8 should be left for Jackson 2.x. So the question remains.
But let's have discussion/vote on 

https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-future-ideas/discussions/73

rename.from: Change JDK baseline for Jackson 3.0 from Java 8 to Java 21 (?)
rename.to: Change JDK baseline for Jackson 3.0 from Java 8 to Java 17 or 21 (?)

body: Quick suggestion: unless anyone objects, I could work on increasing baseline first to JDK 17 (wrt CI). And then if (but only if) decision is made to go to JDK 21 make further changes. This allows finding possible issues wrt change of baseline and tackling most of complexity, regardless of the ultimate decision on exact baseline JDK to use.

Note on work for initial JDK 17 update (which may or may not be the last change, depending on discussions)

## Core

* jackson-annotations: not to be changed (remains Java 8)
* jackson-core: https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-core/pull/1367 (**merged**)
* jackson-databind: https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/pull/4824 (**merged**)

## Jackson-jr

* jackson-jr: https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-jr/pull/178 (**merged**)

## Data formats

* jackson-dataformats-binary: https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformats-binary/pull/531 (**merged**)
* jackson-dataformats-text: https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformats-text/pull/515 (**merged**)
* jackson-dataformat-xml: https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-dataformat-xml/pull/690 (**merged**)

## Data types

* jackson-datatypes-collections: https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-datatypes-collections/pull/169 (**merged**)
* jackson-datatypes-misc: https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-datatypes-misc/pull/50 (**merged**)
* jackson-datatype-joda: https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-datatype-joda/pull/150 (**merged**)

## Other modules

* jackson-modules-base: https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-modules-base/pull/261 (**merged**)
* jackson-modules-java8: https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-modules-java8/pull/332 (**merged**)

## JVM langs:

* jackson-module-kotlin: https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-module-kotlin/pull/863 (**merged**)
* jackson-module-scala: https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-module-scala/issues/696 (**merged**)

## Providers

* Jakarta-RS provider: https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-jakarta-rs-providers/pull/38 (**merged**)
* JAX-RS provider: https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-jaxrs-providers/pull/202 (**merged**)

Go for 17 please otherwise Quarkus, spring and lots of others will be stuck on older Jackson and we'll be all stuck maintaining old code. 

Unless you know of some specific feature in java 21 that Jackson just can't function without and not support from Java 17 then please go for 17.
Your vote + opinion on https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-future-ideas/discussions/73 would be great @maxandersen !

repository.description: Set of support modules for Java 8 datatypes (Optionals, date/time) and features (parameter names)

rename.from: Change JDK baseline for Jackson 3.0 from Java 8 to Java 17 or 21 (?)

issue.title: Update 3.0 (master) build, CI to use Java 17 baseline

repository.name: jackson-module-scala
repository.description: Add-on module for Jackson (https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson) to support Scala-specific datatypes

issue.body: As per https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-databind/issues/4820 I have updated other modules to use Java/JDK 17 as the baseline (pending discussion on whether even later Java version might be used). If Scala module has not yet been upgraded, let's do that (since core components' published versions are built for Java 17 target).

issue.title: Remove dynamic work-arounds wrt accessing `Record` definition

repository.name: jackson-databind
repository.description: General data-binding package for Jackson (2.x): works on streaming API (core) implementation(s)

issue.body:
### Describe your Issue

Since Jackson 3.0 will have JDK baseline of at least 17 (see #4820), we can remove Reflection based access to record information (as well as simplify `ClassUtil.isRecordType()`) and use straight-forward accessors.

issue.title: Remove jdk17 test sources post #4820

repository.name: jackson-databind
repository.description: General data-binding package for Jackson (2.x): works on streaming API (core) implementation(s)

issue.body:
Some clean up after #4820.
We don't have jdk17 test sources anymore.

After this merged, will do the same thing with other modules as well

body: Note: discussion https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-future-ideas/discussions/73 is now closed and JDK 17 was chosen as the baseline (over JDK 21). So changes under this issue are sufficient as-is.
